document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 7

A47D4465866242CE96A5295FAD33A960.description: Write for various audiences, purposes, or tasks for extended time frames

B24707C4E74443419DACD0DBE98EDA8E.description: Write for various audiences, purposes, or tasks for shortened time frames

AB255ACE56844ED0AE15AAC978F0E8F1.description:
Determine appropriate organizational structure to use for various types of writing based upon task, purpose, and
audience

9577DF5CBB364AC48B81454342543BC8.description: Identify appropriate organizational structure for various writings

FC2362878BA247A09127F525CF53BD20.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

88C5F07FBA4A43F6A6853AA0034B1D06.description: Draw upon key ideas and details as support for research

77EF2C3035DB4427B1B431278F37563E.description: Analyze key ideas and details as evidence of understanding text

D9ACD6AF8BE84F4998C1C934F78EC8FC.description: Draw evidence from key ideas and details as support for research

6626D09422F949C8831EB94F44903512.description: Cite textual evidence to analyze explicit text

2A289EF15ECB4E69BFB2F6E777073886.description: Identify key ideas and details to support conclusions through research

FC59905FC9534FE2B2F175B2F791620A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

35BE345883BC4EDFA7B67171F36D53AD.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism

D240CFF5B97F42B9AE5071553E203EB8.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

46DDBE26B596436D9E95F70AA6E8288D.description: Recognize credibility and accuracy of information

18613B7C749A42C4B7538E46B8BDB96D.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

DEB37989FC9A43C69477C495DA6051B0.description: Implement appropriate inquiry methods to conduct a short research project

EE7F66214C2647D9B949FFAF3CE5EBC3.description: Generate additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation

D5E6ED5960D84FE19A777A425F6146C5.description: Conduct steps for research to answer a question

9EBB1EEAA0A44EB1A85A1B82ECED67CF.description: Formulate focused questions from sources of information for further research and investigation

27810FCFD22E4F1E92F746C064B5A080.description: Determine relevant and irrelevant information from sources in order to answer a question

92B349DDF24641A6B1AD804B4767A108.description: Select appropriate sources to answer a question

70BEA51925E54E29A9B5560F1736B4D1.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

F5FCBDAA3A1B486791E7E65F46A95DC4.description: Use technology to interact and collaborate with others

0833B6D5194B4448A34D1A6FBC49B627.description: Use technology to link to and cite sources

F56A4CACFB6947AEB7BBC2A61C49D6BF.description: Use technology (Internet) to produce, revise, edit, and publish writing

C152C89AD45E49D38080614D5B27B91E.description: Determine the best technology options for communicating and collaborating with others for an intended purpose

FDF715661ED64EBC9F635718BF4F7E4F.description:
Determine the best technology tools for producing and publishing writing appropriate to the purpose and
audience

8D0A53B43B2E482DA4249C755716BDB9.description: Identify publishing and collaborative options that use technology

3CFBB6A171C742FF8E6C4CC244F1E837.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

4AE54EE255104E9A99583ACA66F33848.description: Determine how well the focus of audience has been addressed

F38B22307D46429591A1350CC64F95EA.description: Determine how well the focus of the purpose has been addressed

6C39C5B6663544268DEA4F45C3BD445C.description: Develop and strengthen writing by trying a new approach

BB4D0447072A45F9BBF0BDFB5CEC8A82.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, and rewriting

339016101A2D40198AB2871A0AFB7F5B.description: Know how to edit for conventions

5ABD6645C1EC4D9EA00F1D28113EC0A8.description: Recognize how to plan, revise, edit, and rewrite

847351C078E742B585E3235C58C69522.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

1A2136C831734A78859E813058E0C3D6.description: Produce writing with clear and coherent style

7916369B39E64C478CC3B12CA1AD380F.description: Produce writing with clear and coherent organization

F5ED94D7FAAC4351A46BFCD925F46561.description: Produce writing with clear and coherent idea development

9FBC1BB9EB274C109EFDA1143596E227.description: Determine suitable idea development strategies, organization, and style

8922C8ADF7E243C5A8A22BB3CA8D9B7D.description: Analyze the reason for writing to identify task, purpose, and audience

C6713555E47540778632D8CFE67D5C1E.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

9CAD1BD7CEE94C02AE7BDDA48AAF6439.description: Write a narrative that leads to a reflective conclusion

598C432A3F9140CDBCBCD1F5F3FCE78B.description: Write a narrative that uses appropriate precise, descriptive sensory language

439436EF2A084FC687A4DB01454D579E.description: Write a narrative that uses a variety of transitions to convey sequence and signal shifts

0DB762D99D9B4566919284D58CAE1B2A.description: Write a narrative that uses dialogue, pacing and description to develop experiences, events, and characters

5841D0597E01438F89FA413EBC62506A.description: Write a narrative that establishes a context and point of view

40A4FEC8C4184F6A8627E38ED0738B77.description: Write a narrative that engages the reader

608590BE2636405E843F642AEA202ED2.description: Use precise, descriptive, and sensory language to capture the action and to develop experiences and events

AC56A6950BB848CA8880BDFECF20C753.description: Develop conclusions that reflect on the events

D1AB34FA479B48E2A816C2C1CBF5BD28.description: Use a variety of transitions to move events along and to signal shifts

84E257D420554F4F8C749C0A6038B654.description: Use dialogue, pacing, and description to develop events and characters

1C1CE0433CC443F394C973F5C2DA8EA4.description: Use techniques to engage the reader and establish context

D01E062E54004E0AAF61550BE803A1AB.description: Compare/contrast relevant and irrelevant details in developing experiences, events and characters

7781A4B0573D47AFA5DD798D0586DEAB.description:
Identify how authors use precise words/phrases, descriptions, and sensory details to help readers visualize or
sense action

FE8FD262989F4E3CA857314D679041EB.description: Identify various points of view in a narrative

9973D183070F47ADB493B3DA0DE9C24A.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

415755ECFAE54D2E9F0C314575BD73DC.description: Provide a concluding statement or section

F8BB0091504D4CC8844AACDBE09B915B.description: Establish and maintain a formal style

BC5844D87BFC42109CD578AE4A8DBB18.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform or explain

3AF4FF5ED5BD4E54A961A73BFEBA112A.description: Use transitions to clarify the relationships between ideas and concepts

0961CEE6D48046F6988231247C758383.description: Use formatting, graphics and multimedia to aid comprehension

4C7D1A5D22ED4EB1A86B776AD56B440A.description:
Organize ideas, concepts, and information using, definitions, classifications, comparison/contrast, and
cause/effect

787CF614BC094ECEB7397F1B0D557D0D.description: Introduce and develop a topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, and examples

5472A7D3FB7D41849C9FE17AD49FF994.description: Write with analysis of relevant content

C69F92B9FBD64841834D2638581CB676.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic, convey ideas, or explain concepts and information

7A9A2CD1A2D84D6A9C11C21A8E9E15F8.description: Establish and maintain a formal style

8D532327DEA34542B9B1DF668628DB8E.description: Determine precise language and domain-specific vocabulary

A32CBD5C709D438CB5EBCC3D43BEBFBE.description: Select appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify relationships

8CF553BD6A664102AA0EFB7C2A82B6A8.description: Determine how to organize ideas, concepts, and information

CCF9336585694D759F385F5C4D085356.description: Determine when to include graphics or multimedia

394503C6F3E84385BE11A6704015071C.description:
Determine which strategy is most effective to further develop a topic including definitions, classifications,
comparison/contrast, and cause/effect

D04DFD0F5F384463BB3B4016B1B03CD3.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

F91840801A8E4346A36E3F17CB4396C4.description:
Produce an argument to support claims, which provides an appropriate concluding statement that follows from
and supports the argument presented

BE4E98909BF145D4AE7CAEDE27A58812.description: Produce an argument to support claims, which establishes and maintains a formal style

DA6FA0C278714A269CF17C9959A017E8.description:
Produce an argument to support claims, which uses words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify
relationships

C310E9B04AA04945B03BF902B7103B25.description: Produce an argument to support claims, which cites credible and accurate sources

5B3A3C64DCB14EEC96D7CB4A8713A205.description: Produce an argument to support claims, which supports claims with logical reasoning and relevant evidence

6D6D8943D8084445AAE1F60380851E8D.description: Produce an argument to support claims, which is logically organized

E9287B0692F748CE9AB2A4AD4F57764A.description: Produce an argument which introduces claims and acknowledges opposing or alternate claims

E9B2226B5DEE46CCA73ABE0E53B7FFBF.description: Plan a concluding statement following the argument

9439F0E0C5BD45C28F24407D85DF044F.description: Establish and maintain a formal style

D0E3BC48EC3344AB8A5AAEF7714B12E2.description: Evaluate sources for credibility and accuracy

E6F03C3FFD474B01A74C5848709C4579.description: Determine logical and relevant support for claims

434DE46F21CA4D588D16601B0A515021.description: Determine how to introduce claims and acknowledge alternate or opposing claims

819A3DBFB1D84F7BA8A3B9EDC21F4150.description: Identify and define relevance, evidence, argument, and cohesion

59407023B7E34A838B36F3D4B5C5E9A4.description: Identify and define alternate and opposing claims

207620E835DB4E6486F25D1CED609439.description: Recognize phrases and clauses that create cohesion and clarify relationships

0347EBD1E27245E18B8C5B676C8C46A2.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

89B0AF449EC74B6595E8ECA918A896CF.description: Demonstrate correct use of formal English when speaking

348EE2070DA64DA1A3100D84A087C4FA.description: Adapt speech to a given context or task when speaking

80431C565EFC48F49CC19C8910112A48.description: Determine if formal or informal speech is appropriate in the context of a given situation

09DB99BB028844B7BDED10ACF36B8505.description: Describe qualities of formal and informal speech

8DF50493400F4C6596C9C25C0E41030C.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

069AB053B41A42D490459C320243B4A1.description: Use multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to emphasize salient points

F5DA2F18D7DF4D8CA44B781B352B8C41.description: Use multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to clarify claims and findings

8F10D40868AE4320B58BECA914D725D7.description: Determine what multimedia components/visual display options best clarify information

DA5005E1031C41289806373F20D3CD44.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

558157E56DC34079AF38E3B33C29171B.description: Demonstrate appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation

91685F5081BA48FCA340E9EF860C1D20.description: Present information in a focused, coherent manner, including pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples

2FE02059114B4ABAAD7EBCADAB8FF122.description:
Sequence claims, findings, salient points, pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples in a focused,
coherent manner

9C593519DBE54FABAD5AED41F069D3A1.description: Determine salient points and pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples

06AF730F4AEA4EAC9961CF46633AAF7E.description: Identify appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation

E3C399FB765A4507B227184AF7B234B3.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

999CE78F9F1D458896740682308D3732.description: Evaluate the relevance and sufficiency of the speaker’s evidence

C8B8C3DA43AD4FB7B28E4518A315CF57.description: Evaluate the soundness of the speaker’s reasoning

BD46A13C61CF40798A34AC7EAF5B3DE2.description: Identify a speaker’s argument and specific claims

5A91A9E8E38C44F2908864BF3E482F2B.description: Define and identify a speaker’s sound reasoning, arguments, relevant and sufficient evidence, and claims

C355EE21E9074BEDB9F59E07E8E2D7FD.description: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

5A62212506C043368A69883E3060B32E.description: Explain how the ideas clarify the topic, text, and issue studied

429CC143FFF640EBBE557C3DBD3C15BE.description:
Visually, quantitatively, and orally analyze the main ideas and supporting evidence presented in diverse media
formats

7BA6A468321D4114B0F2FEA9B0F32214.description:
Identify main details and supporting details that contribute to the topic, text, and issue studied of various media
formats

6044CA6A945F489CBBF397E9892265E1.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

EEB16B7BF4D24CF1B02B795C6EF1F902.description: Acknowledge new information opposed and respond to change viewpoints as needed

44E45FE8AEC8405492C4D3521D5BFBE7.description: Respond to questions and comments with relevant details, bringing discussion back on topic as needed

E83D5010D0D543F783DDF2C8090F0EBB.description: Pose relevant questions that elicit elaboration

B199A33730414178B45893AB40E5A9A5.description: Engage in a variety of discussions by listening and sharing acquired and prior knowledge

9C5F514937974B79BA1BD88E0F7F1D18.description: Formulate comments, questions, and responses based on evidence

9DB5EE9263674639AFD11ADD296BA3CD.description: Evaluate new information posed and form personal opinion

0F9094DB8F7F4FDA91F8EAFC643B2580.description: Justify ideas and responses shared with evidence from text or research and modify when warranted

C5B5EDDA0F7F47C984C6695F215FFA3A.description: Track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, defining individual roles as needed

3F85E723E4FC424F9BC3F86D8EDCA98B.description: Reflect on discussion topics using evidence

D2CDBE5440DD4614A93FAEEC31A4046B.description: Recognize key ideas and new information during discussions

E57510B3D54F4D518B5F7F0BDE7BDAEC.description: Describe components of a collegial discussion and planning

C10CA0CE4F2F49088F176664D364CC5B.description: Identify key ideas from reading material or research

07AEC757FC634FECA218A2FEEA6ABB0A.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

943CF9A00A494662A30D2C3DC083D65E.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

176ED9F347EC420DABB3616A1DEC0884.description: Compare/contrast fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character against a historical account of the same period

5E6381E6A33E4706BE0BB5F0587F95F3.description: Identify a time, place, or character in a fictional work

163334284BE14388977C588CD49FADCE.description: Identify a time, place, or character in a historical account

66E6358C056A4528ADE3802BB6193CE4.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

9120B09454C14406A48CCC331D5EA45F.description: Determine the differences of text to media

BF0BAE03DF5741C7A719B44E4608C594.description: Determine the similarities of text to media

0DD4D8592AAB4D46ABED15EAA7BA15CE.description: Analyze the effects of various medium techniques on audio, film, stage, and multimedia

B2B5228306BE49999B33CA8192DB2008.description: Analyze the effects of various medium techniques on written text: stories, dramas, and poems

9A1019871C454C1CA0FE9975E635BE36.description: Recognize multimedia, film, and stage versions

E95F60DE155F40E3858B5C6F4A5C0E33.description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

EBC1E6886A6B4E149ED90DE6337F4DAF.description: Analyze how the author contrasts different points of view in a single text

2F7D54C3BD474F40AC86B108CFF41934.description: Analyze how the author develops points of view of different characters or the narrators

E233D19B0CCE4288AB1C73AB2F711455.description: Compare/contrast points of view of different characters or narrators

B5AE70A414FF46A68A782D158DFC5D5F.description: Cite details or examples where the author develops the point of view of various characters or narrators

C960CD68DAC0459F8992CBC1D94274F8.description: Identify authors’ strategies used to contrast points of view of different characters or narrator

95A28A9124D546C0BBA3034BC9B3F53F.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

E5FCDF9C1221404D9A2F1A5B4D68DDBC.description: Analyze the relationship between the poem/drama’s form and structure

08182992C11E4F69BFA06BEF1F446859.description: Analyze the meaning of a drama or poem

033B58329E314543AD5B44F6E73D56B7.description: Analyze the structure of a drama or poem

FAAA15099F644A9695E0CB2B8CDCE305.description: Explain the meaning of a poem

5697029018EB4FEC9955C19FE04CFF26.description: Identify the form/structure of various types of poetry and drama

BB8054F2EBE649BEA1E9C9AF44586349.description: Identify the poetic elements contributing to form/structure

F9F77B818A8C4417B1AF7298964DCA9E.description: Analyze how a drama's or poem's form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning

C9A44280757A486F91520C82E7B3FEDC.description: Analyze the impact of rhymes and repetitions of sounds in a story or drama

0588799798564BC5A0C19D19C0CDB735.description: Analyze the impact of rhymes and repetitions of sounds in a stanza or poem

DE6B3880DB424C7F91D9FA644DF2BA0D.description: Identify rhymes and repetitions of sounds, including alliteration in a story or drama

6BA205C59F934A75A0F8B2D0A35A8443.description: Identify rhymes and repetitions of sounds, including alliteration in a verse or stanza

3E45A492B7054C1FB9C731671EB7094D.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

DB294C1F5F674C60BC91885B49433903.description: Analyze how elements of a story or drama interact

E1645078AB7E4D9A973816C010BB957C.description: Analyze how a change in one element shapes another

95F05A66DCFB4037AB07619FB2FE6124.description: Describe elements of a story or drama

45CB61FD6CB24EC38FAA9F5E9DC29941.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

86B4AA35B00B4257B4B0D85E479EC955.description: Provide an objective summary of a text

384A84FE77844DFA9FDAE524578EF2FA.description: Analyze theme or central idea development over the course of a text

4DF6820C40C149A38B6ECF6B0C96E95A.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text

BEC62CAC482A47788C91B2124E1490DF.description: Identify supporting details of a text

7245A0B62853466A9C960A38E1497F04.description: Recognize theme and central idea of a text

D9C7E27F751D42F0BD4405299C8E20C2.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

D4448E92BA0547C4B53B42E0165E3521.description: Explicitly analyze what a text says

62461240FDF74041ABEE54A312627080.description: Identify explicit information from a text

2047F27436DE474A8767F054DCB46D78.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

99BB384C1A0D4AB2855C44D243C7F9AD.description: Demonstrate understanding of craft and structure

7DFC014D01164053AE74B73C23A3AC85.description: Demonstrate understanding of key ideas and details

7A796002948340DBAA9BA46E938EDE57.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

64F97AAF3029460AA0EAD239672E47B7.description: Analyze how texts by different authors present their ideas by advancing different interpretations of facts

633FEEA4D69948CD841389AFCD00557A.description: Analyze how texts by different authors present their ideas by emphasizing different evidence

A038C2330B124EF793C20AA18C2EC272.description: Identify key information by different authors advancing different interpretations of facts

7B9101734D124D379F7DC85DBDA9D7CA.description: Identify key information by different authors emphasizing different evidence

99CA84E96A404281871C69663CC85302.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

FBB9671FE77B42C6849DAE7BF313B06B.description: Evaluate the argument and specific claims

4B5E7616D07D4746BE1F30BAAEC5F2B1.description: Assess the soundness of the reasoning

A046F52B803B42BD931D8BB688CB4022.description: Assess the sufficiency of evidence for specific claims

975F349DBD1541CB9FB9F2286BD82485.description: Assess the relevance of evidence for specific claims

CDD7C60036724D1EB6FA70D2B0BC23DB.description: Trace the argument and specific claims in a text

B7D1F2EE0B304AC184BCE12EC538B30F.description: Identify the argument and claims in a text

C388D6746954493F85CE18F2D0AE961B.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

CAFDA0A48E6B4154B1BB572BBB416C2E.description: Analyze how the audio, video, or multimedia version of various texts portrays the subject

E78FD149E3B14F92A4D7A5187949E3FB.description: Describe similarities and differences between various media portrayals of subjects

D56F28A4FAB344129D184FC8D3C79E23.description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium's portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

552647DF994B479F8E2A0920DFE1A296.description: Contrast how the author distinguishes his/her position from that of others

EBDDC2746241425083F5238D4EDE35C3.description: Make a distinction between the author’s point of view and those of others mentioned or implied

F55413A7C8E0429F87FB3C70E80A4162.description: Explain how the author conveys his/her point of view

6CE1E1EB14D84C4BA8005E27644109FA.description: Identify details or examples for developing the point of view or purpose

16278345439A4648903E64ED41DADA10.description: Determine the author’s point of view or purpose

F206CAAC069343C1800E29B5D54B77F9.description: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

FDA0AD96E7CA49D5BA601B9C96EA3E19.description: Analyze how a chapter/section contributes to or develops the main idea

A18EC462220C4DA89897CA3DE2106DBA.description: Analyze how paragraphs contribute to or develop the main idea

48FCAB379E434009A2A5157676F7CAC9.description: Analyze how sentences contribute to or develop the main idea

55327CCB03FF4E6C8443C3FFA3D6D81B.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

8C3331D38E1F46638BECC89C7DB95340.description: Analyze how meaning and tone are impacted by specific word choice

99216F92453E4CBD879103BA83812EFD.description: Determine the meaning of figurative, connotative, and technical words/phrases

03815D84491444A79DBD0147F7AE9E31.description: Identify figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases
